page.title: 13History Of Easton
page.content:
Easton(earlier known as{Eastone by {Honingham)}is a village just North of the{Hingham}boundary. Easton belongs to the manor of Costessey. It has a tiny church, some parts of which date back to the 12th century. The village of Easton was situated around the church. In{1348, the Black death {(Plague)}killed nearly{half}of the population and so those remaining moved away, mostly down to the River Tudd. This part of Easton still remains and is now called{Lower Easton
Easton produced a famous scholar, {Adam de Easton,}who became a{Roman {Cardinal.}He was a descendant of an earlier settler in the village, who {took his name from the village,}which was a common practice when surnames were adopted.
